metadata.title: CVE-2021-47489 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/amdgpu: Fix even more out of bound writes from debugfs CVE-2021-42327was fixed by: commit f23750b5b3d98653b31d4469592935ef6364ad67 Author:Thelford Williams <tdwilliamsiv@gmail.com> Date: Wed Oct 13 16:04:13 2021-0400 drm/amdgpu: fix out of bounds write but amdgpu_dm_debugfs.c containsmore of the same issue so fix the remaining ones. v2: * Add missing fix indp_max_bpc_write (Harry Wentland)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47489` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2103-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2103.109
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2103-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2103.109
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
